definition: Cao Yu (1910-1997), PRC dramatist
class or grade/generation/plaintiff and defendant (old)/government department (old)
surname Cao/Zhou Dynasty vassal state
ancient area
archaic variant of 偶[ou3]
legendary monkey of ancient China

sentences.english: "Wang Zhaojun" is one of Caoyu's famous dramas in his late years.
sentences.chinese: 《王昭君》是曹禺先生晚年戲劇創作的代表作之一。

sentences.english: Caoyu s opera is the combination of poem and drama.
sentences.chinese: 曹禺的話劇是詩與戲劇的結合。

sentences.english: The Caoyu is the most important person in Chinese drama history.
sentences.chinese: 曹禺是中國戲劇史上的領銜人物。

sentences.english: "Thunder Storm" is the first multi-act drama of Mr. Cao Yu.
sentences.chinese: 《雷雨》是曹禺先生創作的第一部多幕話劇。

sentences.english: They are publishing a new version of the playscript by Taso Yu this autumn.
sentences.chinese: 今年秋天他們要出版曹禺劇做的一箇舊譯本。

sentences.english: There is conflict between female speech and male narration in Cao Yu s dramas.
sentences.chinese: 曹禺劇作中存在着女性言說與男性敘述的衝撞。

sentences.english: The truly mature of Chinese drama begins with Caoyu.
sentences.chinese: 中國話劇的真正成熟，應從曹禺開始。

sentences.english: Zhou Puyuan is always a disputed character in Cao Yu's play.
sentences.chinese: 周樸園一直是曹禺筆下一個頗有爭議的人物。

definition: Lao She (1899-1966), Chinese novelist and dramatist
Ba Jin (1904-2005), novelist, author of the trilogy 家, 春, 秋
Tian Han (1898-1968), author of the words of the PRC national anthem March of the Volunteer Army 義勇軍進行曲|义勇军进行曲
Mao Dun (1896-1981), Chinese novelist
Ouyang Yuqian (1889-1962), Chinese actor
Anton Pavlovich Chekhov (1860-1904), Russian writer famous for his short stories and plays
Shen Congwen (1902-1988), novelist
Xia Yan (1900-1995), Chinese writer, playwright, socialist critic and movie pioneer
Lu Xun (1881-1936), one of the earliest and best-known modern Chinese writers
Mei Lanfang (1894-1961), famous master of Beijing opera, specialist in female roles
Henrik Ibsen (1828-1906), Norwegian dramatist, author of Doll's House 玩偶之家
Xiao Hong (1911-1942), prominent woman writer, originally from Heilongjiang
Hu Shi (1891-1962), original proponent of writing in colloquial Chinese 白話文|白话文[bai2 hua4 wen2]
Sun Li (1913-2002), novelist
Ma Lianliang (1901-1966), Beijing opera star, one of the Four great beards 四大鬚生|四大须生
Guo Moruo (1892-1978), writer, communist party intellectual and cultural apparatchik
